matrix.distributionPolicy

Interface TaskSplitPolicy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskSplitPolicyMode, TaskSplitPolicyRowSparseness, TaskSplitPolicyST, TaskSplitPolicyStatic

    public interface TaskSplitPolicy
    This interface defines the protocol for implementing strategies to decide in how many task an arithmetic operation should be divided into. Each strategy must define three sub-strategies, one per each of the following operations:
    • Addition (MatrixComputationSparseDistributed.add(Matrix, Matrix)) and Subtraction (MatrixComputationSparseDistributed.subtract(Matrix, Matrix))
    • Multiplication (MatrixComputationSparseDistributed.multiply(Matrix, Matrix))
    • Laplacian (MatrixComputationSparseDistributed.laplacian(Matrix))
    Each sub-strategy returns an integer called PARALLEL_FACTOR that is the approximated number of task in which the operation should be divided into. In some cases, the actual number of generated sub task could be PARRALEL_FACTOR + 1
    Author:
    Antonela Tommasel

      int getTasksForAddOrSubstract(Matrix left, Matrix right)

    • Method Detail

      • getTasksForAddOrSubstract

        int getTasksForAddOrSubstract(Matrix left,
                            Matrix right)
        Returns the parallel factor for add and subtract operations.
        Parameters:
        left - the left summand/minuend of the operation
        right - the right summand/subtrahend of the operation
        Returns:
        the PARALLEL_FACTOR used for computing the work to be assigned to each task

        Returns the parallel factor for multiply operation.
        Parameters:
        left - the left matrix of the multiplication
        right - the right matrix of the multiplication
        Returns:
        the PARALLEL_FACTOR used for computing the work to be assigned to each task

      • getTasksForLaplacian

        int getTasksForLaplacian(Matrix matrix)
        Returns the parallel factor for laplacian operation.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to compute the Laplacian of
        Returns:
        the PARALLEL_FACTOR used for computing the work to be assigned to each task
